snippet: Although the demonstration, which formed shortly after 3 p.m., was generally peaceful, a handful of protesters hurled objects at officers, the authorities said.
abstract: Demonstrators hoping to block Interstate 70 in Berkeley, Mo, to protest fatal shooting of Michael Brown in Ferguson, Mo, are barred by police from entering highway; authorities say 35 people are arrested, most for unlawful assembly, but four are detained for assaulting officers.

byline.contributor: Julie Bosman contributed reporting from Ferguson, Mo.

lead_paragraph: Although the demonstration, which formed shortly after 3 p.m., was generally peaceful, a handful of protesters hurled objects at officers, the authorities said.

headline.main: 35 Arrested as Missouri Police Block Protest on Highway Over Teenager’s Shooting
headline.print_headline: 35 Arrested as Missouri Police Block Protest on Highway Over Teenager’s Shooting
